12. A bond with a face value of $1,000 that pays a coupon of $12.50(1.25%) four times
each year (a quarterly-pay bond) has a coupon rate of (12.50 + 12.50 + 12.50 +
12.50) / 1,000 = 5% and we say it has a periodicity of 4.
The current yield on a bond is the stated (coupon) rate divided by the bond price as a
percentage of face value or, alternatively, the sum of the coupon payments for one year
divided by the bond price.
